verses.verse: ((1 David being in great danger of Saul in the desert of M[…], perceiving the great and inestimable love of God toward him, magnifieth such great mercies,13 and protesteth that he will be thankful for the same.) ) I (He granteth that no pleasure is so great as to feel God’s help in our necessity, neither that anything more stirreth up our love toward him.) love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my prayers.
For he hath inclined his ear unto me, when I did call upon him (That is in convenient time to seek help, which was when he was in distress.) in my days.
When the snares of death compassed me, and the griefs of the grave caught me: When I found trouble and sorrow.
Then I called upon the Name of the Lord, saying, I beseech thee, O Lord, deliver my soul.

The Lord is (He showeth forth the fruit of his love in calling upon him, confessing him to be just and merciful, and to help them that are destitute of aid and counsel.) merciful and righteous, and our God is full of compassion.
The Lord preserveth the simple: I was in misery, and he saved me.
Return unto thy rest, O (Which was unquieted before, now rest upon the Lord, for he hath been beneficial towards thee.) my soul: for the Lord hath been beneficial unto thee,
Because thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.
I shall (The Lord will preserve me, and save my life.) walk before the Lord in the land of the living.
(I felt all these things, and therefore was moved by faith to confess them, 2 Cor. 4:13.) I believed, therefore did I speak: for I was sore troubled.
I said in my (In my great distress I thought God would not regard man, which is but lies and vanity, yet I overcame this tentation, and felt the contrary.) fear, All men are liars.
What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me?

I will (In the Law they used to make a banquet when they gave solemn thanks to God, and to take the cup and drink in sign of thanksgiving.) take the cup of salvation, and call upon the Name of the Lord.
I will pay my vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people.
Precious in the sight of the Lord is the (I perceive that God hath a care over his, so that he both disposeth their death, and taketh an account.) death of his Saints.
Behold, Lord: for I am thy servant, I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid: thou hast broken my bonds.
I will offer to thee a sacrifice of praise, and will call upon the Name of the Lord.
I will pay my (I will thank him for his benefits, for that is a just payment, to confess that we owe all to God.) vows unto the Lord, even now in the presence of all his people,
In the courts of the Lord’s house, even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the Lord.
